page.title: 12LANGUAGE.
page.content: Devonian language in Ilfracombe is dying out.Only older people still know of,or use old Devonshire words. Some examples are:Atchett-barrier hung across a stream to restrain cattle; Brexis-breakfast;Budd'n-rabbit or sheep droppings;Ope-a passage between buildings;Skatt-a shower of rain;Smitch-smoke coming from an indoor fire;Proper job-well done. Devonian slang has a lot of character and people use it to express themselves.Slang is passed down through generations and when people use it,it makes them feel acceptable. Most people nowadays use slang in their everyday language. The younger generation are bringing more swear words into our vocabulary. There is a strong local dialect which makes our language so unique.
